button._tooltip: Selects 𝅝 as the duration for inserting notes or rests
Selects 𝅗𝅥 as the duration for inserting notes or rests
Selects 𝅘𝅥 as the duration for inserting notes or rests
Selects 𝅘𝅥𝅮 as the duration for inserting notes or rests
Selects 𝅘𝅥𝅯 as the duration for inserting notes or rests
Selects 𝅘𝅥𝅱 as the duration for inserting notes or rests

button.label: 3
button._tooltip: Alternates inserting start triplet and end triplet markers

button.label: 𝄞
button._tooltip: Choose any sort of clef. If the cursor is at the start change initial clef, else insert chosen clef.

button.label: ♯♯♭♭
button._tooltip: Insert/Edit a key change at the cursor position
Edit/Insert a time signature change for the current measure

button.label: 𝅘𝅥𝅘𝅥
button._tooltip: Add a note to the current chord The cursor position determines which note to add
Begin Slur from note/chord at cursor, or remove a Begin Slur
End Slur at note/chord at cursor, or remove an End Slur

button.label: 𝅘𝅥⬄𝅘𝅥⌣
button._tooltip: Tie/Untie from the note/chord at the cursor - will be ignored by the LilyPond typesetter if next note is not at the same pitch

button.label: 3
button._tooltip: Alternates inserting start triplet and end triplet markers

button.label: Allegro
button._tooltip: Insert a tempo change at cursor

button.label: f p
button._tooltip: Insert a Dynamic Marking at the cursor

button.label: <
button._tooltip: Start Crescendo from note/chord at cursor

button.label: <|
button._tooltip: End Crescendo on note/chord at cursor

button.label: >
button._tooltip: Start Diminuendo from note/chord at cursor

button.label: >|
button._tooltip: End Diminuendo from note/chord at cursor

button.label: tr
button._tooltip: Adds/Removes a trill to the note
Choose more palettes of buttons.
Help with chord symbol entry methods.
button.script: (d-InfoDialog "There are two methods of adding dynamics, either placing a dynamic directive before the note or chord which it should apply to or creating a separate staff for dynamics. In the second of these options the actual notes on the staff are ignored, they just serve to position the dynamics markings. This method makes it easy to align haripins with each other and with other dynamic markings..")

button.label: f p
button._tooltip: Insert a Dynamic Marking at the cursor

button.label: <
button._tooltip: Start Crescrendo from note/chord at cursor

button.label: <|
button._tooltip: End Crescendo on note/chord at cursor

button.label: >
button._tooltip: Start Diminuendo from note/chord at cursor

button.label: >|
button._tooltip: End Diminuendo from note/chord at cursor

button.label: Staff
button._tooltip: Adds a staff to be used purely for dynamic markings, insert after right hand piano staff

button.label: cresc - - -
button._tooltip: Prints text to start or continue a crescendo extending over a passage. Use for cresc. poco a poco, for example. Terminate with End Crescendo marking or a dynamic mark, else nothing will be printed. LilyPond markup, such as \\bold can be used.

button.label: dim - - -
button._tooltip: Prints text to start or continue a diminuendo extending over a passage. Use for dim. poco a poco, for example. Terminate with End Diminuendo marking or a dynamic mark, else nothing will be printed. LilyPond markup, such as \\bold can be used.

button.label: Extra Space
button._tooltip: Music is spaced out by the extra amount given to avoid textual dynamic markings colliding. Not for hairpins.

button.label: 𝆮
button._tooltip: Prints a Sustain Pedal On Mark

button.label: 𝄞 𝄢
button._tooltip: Adds two staff braced together for keyboard instrument.

button.label: <>
button._tooltip: Adds a staff to be used purely for dynamic markings, insert after right hand piano staff

button.label: 𝆯
button._tooltip: Prints a Sustain Off Mark
(Print) the current voice moves to the staff you name.

button.label: 8va
button._tooltip: Inserts an 8va mark (transposing the notes accordingly) or terminates one already started.

When appending, appends a 𝅝 With the cursor on a note inserts a 𝅝 before the current note If MIDI-in is active, the note will be pitchless (displays yellow, percussion-sounding) - the MIDI keyboard will provide the pitch. Changes prevailing duration.

When appending, appends a 𝅗𝅥 With the cursor on a note inserts a 𝅗𝅥 before the current note If MIDI-in is active, the note will be pitchless (displays yellow, percussion-sounding) - the MIDI keyboard will provide the pitch. Changes prevailing duration.

When appending, appends a 𝅘𝅥 With the cursor on a note inserts a 𝅘𝅥 before the current note If MIDI-in is active, the note will be pitchless (displays yellow, percussion-sounding) - the MIDI keyboard will provide the pitch. Changes prevailing duration.

When appending, appends a 𝅘𝅥𝅮 With the cursor on a note inserts a 𝅘𝅥𝅮 before the current note If MIDI-in is active, the note will be pitchless (displays yellow, percussion-sounding) - the MIDI keyboard will provide the pitch. Changes prevailing duration.

When appending, appends a 𝅘𝅥𝅯 With the cursor on a note inserts a 𝅘𝅥𝅯 before the current note If MIDI-in is active, the note will be pitchless (displays yellow, percussion-sounding) - the MIDI keyboard will provide the pitch. Changes prevailing duration.

When appending, appends a 𝅘𝅥𝅰 With the cursor on a note inserts a 𝅘𝅥𝅰 before the current note If MIDI-in is active, the note will be pitchless (displays yellow, percussion-sounding) - the MIDI keyboard will provide the pitch. Changes prevailing duration.
Insert 𝄻 rest
Insert 𝄼 rest
Insert 𝄽 rest
Insert 𝄾 rest
Insert 𝄿 rest
Insert 𝅀 rest
Dot, double dot or undot the note at the cursor
Change the current note to a 𝅝
Change the current note to a 𝅗𝅥
Change the current note to a 𝅘𝅥
Change the current note to a 𝅘𝅥𝅮
Change the current note to a 𝅘𝅥𝅯
Change the current note to a 𝅘𝅥𝅰
Dot, double dot or undot the note at the cursor
Halves the duration of the note/chord/rest at the cursor or the selection. E.g. Quarter Note becomes Eighth Note.
Doubles the duration of the note/chord/rest at the cursor or the selection. E.g. Quarter Note becomes Half Note.

button.label: ► A
button._tooltip: Changes the note the cursor is on to the note A. If the cursor is in the appending position, appends a note using the prevailing duration.

button.label: ► B
button._tooltip: Changes the note the cursor is on to the note B. If the cursor is in the appending position, appends a note using the prevailing duration.

button.label: ► C
button._tooltip: Changes the note the cursor is on to the note C. If the cursor is in the appending position, appends a note using the prevailing duration.

button.label: ► D
button._tooltip: Changes the note the cursor is on to the note D. If the cursor is in the appending position, appends a note using the prevailing duration.

button.label: ► E
button._tooltip: Changes the note the cursor is on to the note E. If the cursor is in the appending position, appends a note using the prevailing duration.

button.label: ► F
button._tooltip: Changes the note the cursor is on to the note F. If the cursor is in the appending position, appends a note using the prevailing duration.

button.label: ► G
button._tooltip: Changes the note the cursor is on to the note G. If the cursor is in the appending position, appends a note using the prevailing duration.
Changes the note at the cursor to an octave higher
Changes the note at the cursor to an octave lower
Forces the accidental on the note to be printed.
Prints the accidental in ().
Sharpen the note at the cursor or next entered note if the cursor is in the appending position
Flatten the note at the cursor or next entered note if the cursor is in the appending position

button.label: tr
button._tooltip: Adds/Removes a trill to the note

button.label: 
button._tooltip: Adds/Removes a Mordent to the note

button.label: 
button._tooltip: Adds/Removes a prall to the note

button.label: 
button._tooltip: Adds/Removes Up Prall ornament

button.label: 𝆗
button._tooltip: Add/Removes a Turn to the note

button.label: 𝆘
button._tooltip: Add/Removes a Reverse Turn to the note

button.label: tr 
button._tooltip: Starts a spanning trill from the note at the cursor.

button.label:  end
button._tooltip: Ends a previously started trill at the next note.
Mark/Unmark current selection or note with UpBow
Mark/Unmark selection or current object

button.label: 
button._tooltip: Mark/Unmark current selection or object with a harmonic
Mark/Unmark the selected notes arpeggio

button.label: 𝆂
button._tooltip: Marks/Unmaks the selection with the Portato
Mark/Unmark the selected notes stopped
Inserts fingering for open string
Inserts fingering for finger 1
Inserts fingering for finger 2
Inserts fingering for finger 3
Inserts fingering for finger 4
Inserts fingering for finger 5

button.label: s1
button._tooltip: Creates a cloned Denemo Directive

button.label: s2
button._tooltip: Creates a cloned Denemo Directive

button.label: s3
button._tooltip: Creates a cloned Denemo Directive

button.label: s4
button._tooltip: Creates a cloned Denemo Directive

button.label: s5
button._tooltip: Creates a cloned Denemo Directive

button.label: s6
button._tooltip: Creates a cloned Denemo Directive

button.label: s?
button._tooltip: Followed by a number, places string number on note.

button.label: p i m
button._tooltip: The given number as right hand fingering, using the conventional p,m,i indicators. Use Cancel to delete

button.label: RH
button._tooltip: Asks for a finger number and typesets p,m,i as appropriate. Use cancel to delete.

button.label: Harmonic
button._tooltip: Places a diamond shape notehead at the cursor. Invoke this command with the cursor above the note to be fingered/fretted to notate an artificial harmonic.

button.label: V+
button._tooltip: Adds a voice to the current staff, initially displayed on a staff of its own, for readability. It will print on the staff above, and can be displayed there using Join Voices command if desired.

button.label: V?
button._tooltip: Select a voice for the music following the cursor position. The Voice 1,2,3,4 choices set up the voices so that first and third voices get stems up, second and fourth voices get stems down, third and fourth voice note heads are horizontally shifted, and rests in the respective voices are automatically moved to avoid collisions. The Automatic Voice setting returns all the voice settings to the neutral default directions

button.label: V(V)
button._tooltip: The two voices will be printed only once when they are the same, otherwise they will be printed as parts. (Off/On)
(Print) Merges rests where two voices have a common rest. Not for whole measure or multi-measure rests.

button.label: 𝅘𝅥𝅘𝅥
button._tooltip: Turns off horizontal displacement of notes (which avoid collisions between parts)

button.label: 𝅘𝅥𝅘𝅥
button._tooltip: Turns on horizontal displacements of notes where needed.
On printing the current note/chord will be shifted from notes in other voices by the amount you give. Use with Voice Presets to ensure this chord is in a different voice.

button.label: Initial Voice
button._tooltip: Choose which voice this staff will initially be set to. To change voice during music see the Directives->Voices menu.

button.label: Merge Dotted
button._tooltip: From this point in the music notes in different voices beginning at the same time will be merged onto the same stem even if they differ in the dotting.

button.label: Un-merge Dotted
button._tooltip: From this point notes in different voices that begin at the same time will not be merged onto the same stem if they differ in the dotting.

button.label: Part Combine Two
button._tooltip: The two voices will be printed only once when they are the same, otherwise they will be printed as parts. (Off/On)

button.label: Part Combine Chords
button._tooltip: From the cursor onwards chords will be combined from the parts included in the part combine command.

button.label: Unisono
button._tooltip: Combine parts as unison.

button.label: Automatic
button._tooltip: Reverts to the default part combining.

button.label: Keep Voices Apart
button._tooltip: When part combining, from this point the parts will be kept apart even though they could be combined.

button.label: Note Column Warnings
button._tooltip: Turns warnings from the LilyPond typesetter about clashing note columns off or on. These can be harmless but can cause a warning to check the score.

button.label: fermata.svg
button._tooltip: Mark/Unmark current selection or object with a fermata

button.label: staccato.svg
button._tooltip: Adds the staccato dot or removes it

button.label: staccatissimo.svg
button._tooltip: Toggles Staccatissimo

button.label: tenuto.svg
button._tooltip: Toggles the Tenuto Line _ On/Off

button.label: accent.svg
button._tooltip: Adds the > accent

button.label: marcato.svg
button._tooltip: Mark/Unmark the selected notes marcato

button.label: Outside Slur
button._tooltip: The articulation(s) on this note will be placed outside the slur (furthest from the note). Repeat the command to return the slur to the outside.
Insert a barline indicating the start of a repeated section.
Insert a barline indicating the end of a repeated section.
Inserts a barline ending one repeated section and starting another
Insert a double barline at cursor position.
Inserts a closing barline (a double bar with last one thicker).

button.label: |x
button._tooltip: Skips the printing of any automatic barline here - allows line break.

button.label: Choose
button._tooltip: Choose a barline

button.label: Custom
button._tooltip: Create a custom barline. These can be named, or can simply override a standard LilyPond bar line type. A bar line is defined by four forms, which describe 1) the appearance normally (during a line), 2) appearance when the barline is at the beginning or 3) end of a line , and 4) what to show when joining staffs together as with a Piano Staff. Barline forms are made of characters including |,:,.,[,],: and others in the LilyPond documentation.
(Print) start a first time bar, must be followed by EndVolta.
(Print) start a second time bar, must be followed by EndVolta
Ends a volta, that is a n'th time bar

button.label: insert 1st and 2nd
button._tooltip: Inserts first and second time bars each with a whole measure rest. You can then edit this to suit your music, e.g by inserting extra bars, deleting the repeat start etc.

button.label: nth time
button._tooltip: Start passage to be played on one or more of the repeats as indicated by the text given by the user (e.g. 3 for third time bar). Finish the passage by placing the End ... time bar command.

button.label: start |:
button._tooltip: Insert a barline indicating the start of a repeated section.

button.label: end :|
button._tooltip: Insert a barline indicating the end of a repeated section.

button.label: e/s :||:
button._tooltip: Inserts a barline ending one repeated section and starting another

button.label: Short Measure
button._tooltip: Allow too few notes/rests in this measure. LilyPond will engrave this measure (in all staffs) with the short duration given by notes already present when this command was issued.

button.label: Set Bar Number
button._tooltip: Enter a number to change the lilypond bar number. The printout will continue to count up from there.
Help with beaming commands.
button.script: (d-InfoDialog "Beaming commands affect the printed score, not the Denemo display which uses a simple beaming method for quick note entry. You may find it easier to use the beaming commands directly on the typeset score - right click to select a beamed note and right click on the selection box to choose a beaming command.")

button._tooltip: Instructs the LilyPond engraver to start a beam here. (Print effect only)
Instructs LilyPond engraver to stop previously started manual beaming. Print effect only.

button.label: [x
button._tooltip: Typeset the note at the cursor with no beam to the right.

button.label: ]x
button._tooltip: Typeset the note at the cursor with no beam to the left.
Prints with just one beam linking to the right.
Prints with just one beam linking to left.
Prints with just two beams linking to the right.
Prints with just two beams linking to the left.
Prints with just three beams linking to the right.
Prints with just three beams linking to the left.

button.label: ][x
button._tooltip: (Print) Removes beam from current note

button.label: [n][m]...
button._tooltip: Inserts a time signature with indication for how to beam the notes. Insert at beginning of staff in order to replace the initial time signature. Time Signature can be hidden on printing - see Time Signatures menu.

button.label: Score-wide Rules
button._tooltip: Sets the rules to be used for beaming. With no selection gets the beat for beams to be divided for the prevailing time signature at the cursor. If a there is a selection this will set exceptions to the regular rule. In this case indicate the beaming desired using the manual beam commands [ and ].

button.label: Movement Rules
button._tooltip: Add/Replace rules to be used for beaming in the current movement. With no selection gets the beat for beams to be divided for the prevailing time signature at the cursor. If a there is a selection this will be used as the set of rules. In this case indicate the beaming desired using the manual beam commands [ and ], giving all the beaming rules wanted using several measures if needed (no other rules are used). Repeat with different selections to add further rules.

button.label: Time Signature
button._tooltip: Inserts a time signature with indication for how to beam the notes. Insert at beginning of staff in order to replace the initial time signature.

button.label: ->
button._tooltip: Add a bass figure to the current note. Use | sign to split the duration of a note so as to have multiple figures on one note. See Lilypond docs for other notation
Sets the height of the bass figure above the note. The unit is the distance between adjacent lines in the staff.
Allows several groups of figures to be individually adjusted for height.

button.label: 𝅘𝅥 = n
button._tooltip: Start filtering MIDI events, First note is bass, hold this down while entering notes for figures. Pedal changes harmony on same bass.

button.label: Hide
button._tooltip: Hide the figured bass on the current staff on printing

button.label: Show
button._tooltip: Show the figured bass on the current staff on printing

button.label: Delete All
button._tooltip: Delete the figured bass on the current staff

button.label: Set Mensural Clef
button._tooltip: Set this staff to use mensural notation (on/off)
button.script:
;;;;;Clef MensuralNotationStaff (let ((tag "MensuralNotationStaff")(syntax (RadioBoxMenu (cons (_ "LilyPond Clef Name") 'name) (cons (_ "Full LilyPond clef syntax") 'full)))) (case syntax ((full) (set! syntax (d-GetLilyPondSyntaxFromUser (_ "Mensural Clef") (_ "Give LilyPond syntax for clef desired") "\\score {<< {" "c'^\\markup\\huge{C} d'^\\markup\\huge{D} e'^\\markup\\huge{E} f'^\\markup\\huge{F} g'^\\markup\\huge{G} a'^\\markup\\huge{A} b'^\\markup\\huge{B}}>>}" "\\clef \"mensural-g\" \\set Staff.clefPosition = #-4 \\set Staff.middleCPosition = #-8 \\set Staff.middleCClefPosition = #-8\n"))) ((name) (set! syntax (d-GetUserInput (_ "Custom Clef") (_ "Give LilyPond syntax for clef name") "mensural-c1")) (if syntax (set! syntax (string-append "\\clef \"" syntax "\" ")))))
(if syntax (begin (d-DirectivePut-clef-postfix tag syntax) (d-DirectivePut-clef-override tag DENEMO_OVERRIDE_LILYPOND ) (d-InfoDialog (_ "N.B.The Denemo display will show notes using prevailing Denemo clef,\nbut they will be typeset in the clef given")) (d-SetSaved #f) (d-RefreshDisplay))))

button.label: Set Mensural Key Style
button._tooltip: Set this staff to use mensural notation (on/off)

button.label: Set Mensural Note Style
button._tooltip: Set this staff to use mensural notation (on/off)

button.label: Whole Measure Rest
button._tooltip: Inserts a whole measure rest in mensural notation.
button.script: (let ((tag "MensuralWholeMeasureRest")) (d-Directive-standalone tag) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-prefix tag (string-append "\\hide R1*" (d-GetPrevailingTimesig) " ")) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-postfix tag "-\\tweak #'extra-offset #'(0 . -2.1)^\\markup {\\musicglyph #\"rests.0neomensural\"} ") (d-DirectivePut-standalone-display tag (_ "Mensural Whole Measure Rest")) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-data tag "'((y-offset . \"-2.1\"))") (d-SetDurationInTicks (* 1536 (GetPrevailingTimeSig #t))) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-minpixels tag 30) ;(d-DirectivePut-standalone-allow tag (d-GetLayoutId)) (d-SetSaved #f) (d-RefreshDisplay))

button.label: No Augmentation Dot
button._tooltip: Hides dots on the current chord/rest. Makes it conditional on the current layout.
button.script: (let ((tag "NoDot")) (d-DirectivePut-chord-prefix tag "\\once\\override Dots.dot-count = #0 ") (d-DirectivePut-chord-postfix tag " ") (d-DirectivePut-chord-display tag "No Dot") (d-DirectivePut-chord-allow tag (d-GetLayoutId)) (d-DirectivePut-chord-override tag DENEMO_OVERRIDE_AFFIX) (d-SetSaved #f))

button._tooltip: Help with chord symbol entry methods.
button.script: (d-InfoDialog "Chord Symbols (or \"fake chords\") can be created in two ways. The first attaches a chord symbol to any note. You have to give the name of the chord required, e.g. C7. This is ok if chord changes only occur on note starts. The other way is to create a voice specially for chords. You can then enter the actual chords as music notation and they will typeset as chord names.")

button.label: Attach by Name
button._tooltip: Attach a chord symbol to the note at the cursor position. E.G.cis:dim7 for c-sharp diminished 7th. See Lilypond docs for notation

button.label: Chord Symbol Staff
button._tooltip: The current staff becomes a chord symbol staff. The music on this staff will be typeset as chord symbols. Normally you will make this staff a voice on the melody staff, so that the chord symbols print on the melody staff.

button.label: ⬅ MIDI
button._tooltip: Opens a MIDI file for transcribing. Load each track in turn and insert the MIDI notes by playing the durations.

button.label: ⬤
button._tooltip:
Starts playing the score from the playhead start (green marker bar) and simultaneously records your playing from MIDI in. You can stop the playback at any time and then the first MIDI note you entered is marked.
Entering duration keys now enters the notes you played into the score.
If you have no click track at the top one is created.

button.label: 𝟀 MIDI
button._tooltip: Deletes the MIDI that has been imported or recorded via MIDI in.

button.label: 𝄞 c ⬧⬧⬧⬧|⬧⬧⬧⬧|¾⬧⬧⬧|
button._tooltip: Creates a staff (a click track) at the top of this score from the imported MIDI using tempo and time signature information (if present). The measures are filled with drum beats so that pitches in the MIDI tracks can be displayed above them. When you have finished the import you can delete this staff.

Creates a staff below the click track for the MIDI track selected. The staff is empty except for time signature and tempo changes. The MIDI pitches from the track are displayed above the click track and notes can be inserted by double-clicking on a MIDI pitch and entering the rhythm.
Creates a staff for the imported MIDI track previous to the current one, making that the current one.
Creates a staff for the next MIDI track after the current one, making that the current one.

button.label: <<
button._tooltip: The first recorded or imported MIDI note onset in the current track becomes marked so that entered durations will be given its pitch.
Removes the mark from the MIDI note onset, so that inserting durations have their normal meaning.

button.label: <
button._tooltip: Moves the marked MIDI note onset to the one before the current one.

button.label: >
button._tooltip: Moves to the next MIDI note onset in the current recorded or imported MIDI track. Inserted durations will take their pitch from this note.
Inserts the marked MIDI note from the current track, using the duration suggested. Use duration keys to insert the same note with a different duration.

button.label: 𝅘𝅥⬄𝅘𝅥⌣
button._tooltip: Tie/Untie from the note/chord at the cursor - will be ignored by the LilyPond typesetter if next note is not at the same pitch
Gives a choice of shape modifications to make to the following tie.

button.label: ⌣𝅘𝅥
button._tooltip: The note at the cursor ends a tie that has begun elsewhere, usually in a first time bar. That is it is a repeat of the tie ending.

button.label: 𝅘𝅥⌣
button._tooltip: Places a tie after the note at the cursor, tying to nothing. Use for laissez vibrer or when a tie comes at a final repeat.

button.label: Up
button._tooltip: Ties to next note, tie upwards, or removes tie.

button.label: Down
button._tooltip: Ties to the following note/chord with tie downwards.

button.label: Note Auto
button._tooltip: Ties the note at the cursor leaving other notes in the current chord unchanged.

button.label: Note Up
button._tooltip: Ties the individual note in a chord the tie being above; repeat command to remove.

button.label: Note Down
button._tooltip: Ties the individual note at the cursor the tie going down; repeat to remove.

button.label: Fix Slur/Tie
button._tooltip: Corrects for the slur/tie error common in imported scores. Scans entire score for pairs of identical notes slurred together as a pair. Changes these to a tied note. Do not use in the unusual case of identical notes slurred (e.g. across strings).

button.label: Create/Load
button._tooltip: Allows the user to create a customized ornament (or load one previously created) into this score's definitions. Ornament names should be start in lower case and have no numerals. If a standard ornament is used, e.g. trill, then this will replace the standard ornament throughout the score.

button.label: Edit
button._tooltip: Edit the definition (size or appearance) of a custom ornament definition. The definition must already have been created in this score.

button.label: Attach (Off/On)
button._tooltip: Typesets a custom ornament on the current note/chord. Removes that ornament if already present.

button.label: Insert
button._tooltip: Inserts an ornament (or other LilyPond Definition) as a separate object (it will appear on the previous note)

button.label: Chord Chart Staff
button._tooltip: Prints Chord symbols separated by bar lines. Repeats, time signatures and text are also printed for this staff.
button.script: ;;CompactChordChart (d-ChordChartStaff 'compact) (d-SelectPalette (_ "Chord Inserts")) ((RadioBoxMenu (cons (_ "Use keys a,b,c ..g to move cursor") (lambda () (d-AddKeybinding "JumpUpOctave" "apostrophe") (d-AddKeybinding "JumpDownOctave" "comma") (d-NumbersSelectDuration) (d-NoteNamesMove))) (cons (_ "Leave keyboard shortcuts unchanged") (lambda () (disp "unchanged")))))

button.label: Create Special Barline
button._tooltip: Create a custom barline. These can be named, or can simply override a standard LilyPond bar line type. A bar line is defined by four forms, which describe 1) the appearance normally (during a line), 2) appearance when the barline is at the beginning or 3) end of a line , and 4) what to show when joining staffs together as with a Piano Staff. Barline forms are made of characters including |,:,.,[,],: and others in the LilyPond documentation.

button.label: Special Barline
button._tooltip: Insert a previously created barline. (Any other LilyPond definitions - see Score->LilyPond Definition - are here too).

button.label: Line Break
button._tooltip: Start a new line at this measure.

button.label: Whole Measure Repeat
button._tooltip: Inserts a whole measure repeat sign.

button.label: Change Chord Size
button._tooltip: Typeset the chord at the cursor larger or smaller than normal.
button.script: ;;;CompactChordScale (let* ((tag "CompactChordScale")(scalex "2.0") (scaley "2.0") (data (d-DirectiveGet-standalone-data tag))) (if data (begin (d-DirectiveDelete-standalone tag) (set! data (eval-string data)) (set! scalex (car data)) (set! scaley (cdr data)))) (set! scalex (d-GetUserInput (_ "Chord Symbol Scale") (_ "Give horizontal scaling for next chord") scalex)) (if scalex (begin (set! scaley (d-GetUserInput (_ "Chord Symbol Scale") (_ "Give vertical scaling for next chord") scaley)) (if scaley (begin (d-DirectivePut-standalone tag) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-postfix tag (string-append "\\once \\set Score.chordCompactScale = #'(" scalex " . " scaley ") ")) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-display tag "Scale") (d-DirectivePut-standalone-data tag (format #f "'~s" (cons scalex scaley))) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-minpixels tag 30) (d-SetSaved #f) (d-RefreshDisplay))))))

button.label: Offset Chord
button._tooltip: Offsets the Chord symbol generated by the chord at the cursor.

button.label: Add Bass Inversion
button._tooltip: Adds a bass note to a chord, while keeping the current lowest note as the root of the chord. Use this on Chord Symbol staffs to create an inversion of the chord entered.

button.label: Flatten Next Bass Note
button._tooltip: Use in appending position to flatten the bass note of the next chord (extra to what it would be).

button.label: Sharpen Next Bass Note
button._tooltip: Use in appending position to sharpen the bass note of the next chord (extra to what it would be).
Set the prevailing duration to 𝅝 (subsequent chords entered will have this duration)
Set the prevailing duration to 𝅗𝅥 (subsequent chords entered will have this duration)
Set the prevailing duration to 𝅘𝅥 (subsequent chords entered will have this duration)
Insert a repeated chord sign.

button.label: Section Mark
button._tooltip: Inserts an arbitrary mark in the score at the cursor. Any size, font, effect can be chosen. The text position can be dragged in the print view if needed. Avoid placing one at the start as it clashes with the time signature - place it after the first note and drag it into position.

button.label: Fix Number of Lines
button._tooltip: Specify the number of lines you want on the page.

button.label: Insert Whole Measure Spacer
button._tooltip: Inserts a non-printing whole measure after the current measure with a directive to omit the barline. This gives a one measure spacer.

button.label: Fret Diagram
button._tooltip: Creates a dialog for you to enter a description of the fret diagram to be typeset at the cursor position.

button.label: Alternate Chord
button._tooltip: Turn the chord at the cursor into an alternate chord, typeset above and colored. This appears in the display as small notes (a grace note). Edit the position with the offset chord button.

button.label: Space Below Title
button._tooltip: Inserts blank space above the movement.

button.label: Mute/UnMute Staff
button._tooltip: Mutes the current staff. Affects only playback.

button.label: Play/Pause
button._tooltip: Playback from start marker to end marker (Set these markers in the playback controls)

button.label: Stop
button._tooltip: Stop Playback

button.label: Play Selection
button._tooltip: Plays all staffs for the duration of the selection or from the current cursor position to the end of the movement if no selection.

button.label: New
button._tooltip: Starts a new Gregorian score.

button.label: Do1
button._tooltip: Inserts a Do1 clef.
button.script: (let ((tag "Vaticana")) (d-InitialClef "Alto") (d-DirectivePut-clef-postfix tag "\\clef \"vaticana-do1\" ") (d-DirectivePut-clef-graphic tag "  Emmentaler 80") (d-DirectivePut-clef-override tag (logior DENEMO_OVERRIDE_GRAPHIC DENEMO_OVERRIDE_LILYPOND)) (d-DirectivePut-clef-gy tag 20) (d-SetSaved #f))

button.label: Do2
button._tooltip: Inserts a Do2 clef.
button.script: (let ((tag "Vaticana")) (d-InitialClef "Tenor") (d-DirectivePut-clef-postfix tag "\\clef \"vaticana-do2\" ") (d-DirectivePut-clef-graphic tag "  Emmentaler 80") (d-DirectivePut-clef-override tag (logior DENEMO_OVERRIDE_GRAPHIC DENEMO_OVERRIDE_LILYPOND)) (d-DirectivePut-clef-gy tag 10) (d-SetSaved #f))

button.label: Do3
button._tooltip: Inserts a Do3 clef.
button.script: (let ((tag "Vaticana")) (d-InitialClef "Baritone") (d-DirectivePut-clef-postfix tag "\\clef \"vaticana-do3\" ") (d-DirectivePut-clef-graphic tag "  Emmentaler 80") (d-DirectivePut-clef-override tag (logior DENEMO_OVERRIDE_GRAPHIC DENEMO_OVERRIDE_LILYPOND)) (d-DirectivePut-clef-gy tag 0) (d-SetSaved #f))

button.label: Fa1
button._tooltip: Inserts a Fa1 clef.
button.script: (let ((tag "Vaticana")) (d-InitialClef "Baritone") (d-DirectivePut-clef-postfix tag "\\clef \"vaticana-fa1\" ") (d-DirectivePut-clef-graphic tag "  Emmentaler 80") (d-DirectivePut-clef-override tag (logior DENEMO_OVERRIDE_GRAPHIC DENEMO_OVERRIDE_LILYPOND)) (d-DirectivePut-clef-gy tag 20) (d-SetSaved #f))

button.label: Fa2
button._tooltip: Inserts a Fa2 clef.
button.script: (let ((tag "Vaticana")) (d-InitialClef "Bass") (d-DirectivePut-clef-postfix tag "\\clef \"vaticana-fa2\" ") (d-DirectivePut-clef-graphic tag "  Emmentaler 80") (d-DirectivePut-clef-override tag (logior DENEMO_OVERRIDE_GRAPHIC DENEMO_OVERRIDE_LILYPOND)) (d-DirectivePut-clef-gy tag 10) (d-SetSaved #f))

button.label: Begin Melisma
button._tooltip: Inserts (or deletes) a melisma start.

button.label: End Melisma
button._tooltip: Inserts (or deletes) a melisma end.
Starts a ligature.
Ends a ligature.

button.label: Flexa
button._tooltip: Inserts (or deletes) a flexa.
button.script:
(let ((tag "Flexa"))
(if (d-Directive-chord? tag) (begin ; a flexa directive already exists -> delete it (disp "Deleting existing flexa ...") (disp "Cursor is at flexa " (d-DirectiveGet-chord-data tag)) (if (d-DirectiveGet-chord-data tag) ; if it's the start of a flexa (begin (disp "Deleting felxa from start") (d-DirectiveDelete-chord tag) (d-NextChord) (d-DirectiveDelete-chord tag)) (begin ; if it's the end of a flexa (disp "Deleting flexa from end") (d-DirectiveDelete-chord tag) (d-PrevChord) (d-DirectiveDelete-chord tag)))) (begin ; no Flexa directive exists yet -> create a flexa (disp "Creating a flexa ...") (if (and (not (d-HasSelection)) (d-PrevChord)) (begin (d-SetMark) (d-NextChord) (d-SetPoint))) (if (MoveToSelectionBeginningInThisStaff) (begin (d-DirectivePut-chord-prefix tag "\\[ ") (d-DirectivePut-chord-postfix tag "\\flexa ") (d-DirectivePut-chord-display tag "fl--") (d-DirectivePut-chord-override tag 16) (d-DirectivePut-chord-data tag "'start") (if (d-NextChord) (begin (d-DirectivePut-chord-postfix tag "\\] ") (d-DirectivePut-chord-display tag "--]") (d-DirectivePut-chord-override tag 16))) (d-MoveCursorRight) (d-SetSaved #f)) (d-WarningDialog (_ "You must select two notes"))))))

button.label: Pes
button._tooltip: Inserts (or deletes) a pes.
button.script:
(let ((tag "Pes"))
(if (d-Directive-chord? tag) (begin ; a flexa directive already exists -> delete it (if (d-DirectiveGet-chord-data tag) ; if it's the start of a pes (begin (d-DirectiveDelete-chord tag) (d-NextChord) (d-DirectiveDelete-chord tag)) (begin ; if it's the end of a pes (d-DirectiveDelete-chord tag) (d-PrevChord) (d-DirectiveDelete-chord tag)))) (begin ; no pes directive exists yet -> create one (if (and (not (d-HasSelection)) (d-PrevChord)) (begin (d-SetMark) (d-NextChord) (d-SetPoint))) (if (MoveToSelectionBeginningInThisStaff) (begin (d-DirectivePut-chord-prefix tag "\\[ ") (d-DirectivePut-chord-postfix tag "\\pes ") (d-DirectivePut-chord-display tag "p--") (d-DirectivePut-chord-override tag 16) (d-DirectivePut-chord-data tag "'start") (if (d-NextChord) (begin (d-DirectivePut-chord-postfix tag "\\] ") (d-DirectivePut-chord-display tag "--]") (d-DirectivePut-chord-override tag 16))) (d-MoveCursorRight) (d-SetSaved #f)) (d-WarningDialog (_ "You must select two notes"))))))

button.label: Ictus
button._tooltip: Inserts (or deletes) an ictus.

button.label: Episem Initium
button._tooltip: Inserts (or deletes) an episem initium.

button.label: Episem Finis
button._tooltip: Inserts (or deletes) an episem finis.

button.label: Augmentum
button._tooltip: Inserts (or deletes) an augmentum dot.
Inserts a Divisio Minor.
button.script: (let ((tag "DivisioMinima")) (d-Directive-standalone tag) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-minpixels tag 10) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-override tag DENEMO_OVERRIDE_GRAPHIC) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-gy tag -25) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-graphic tag " ❙ Denemo 20") (d-DirectivePut-standalone-postfix tag " s \\divisioMinima") (if (Appending?) (d-AddMeasure) (d-SplitMeasure)) (d-RefreshDisplay) (d-MoveCursorRight))

button._tooltip: Inserts a Divisio Maior.
button.script: (let ((tag "DivisioMaior")) (d-Directive-standalone tag) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-postfix tag " s \\divisioMaior") (d-DirectivePut-standalone-graphic tag " 𝄀 Denemo 26 bold") (d-DirectivePut-standalone-minpixels tag 10) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-override tag DENEMO_OVERRIDE_GRAPHIC) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-gy tag 3) (if (Appending?) (d-AddMeasure) (d-SplitMeasure)) (d-SetSaved #f) (d-RefreshDisplay))

button._tooltip: Inserts a Divisio Maxima.
button.script: (let ((tag "DivisioMaxima")) (d-Directive-standalone tag) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-postfix tag " s \\divisioMaxima") (d-DirectivePut-standalone-graphic tag " ⃒⃒ Denemo 44 bold") (d-DirectivePut-standalone-minpixels tag 10) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-override tag DENEMO_OVERRIDE_GRAPHIC) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-gy tag 9) (if (Appending?) (d-AddMeasure) (d-SplitMeasure)) (d-SetSaved #f) (d-RefreshDisplay))

button._tooltip: Inserts a finalis.
button.script: (let ((tag "Finalis")) (d-Directive-standalone tag) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-postfix tag " s \\finalis") (d-DirectivePut-standalone-graphic tag " ‖ Denemo 44 bold") (d-DirectivePut-standalone-minpixels tag 10) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-override tag DENEMO_OVERRIDE_GRAPHIC) (d-DirectivePut-standalone-gy tag 9) (if (Appending?) (d-AddMeasure) (d-SplitMeasure)) (d-SetSaved #f) (d-RefreshDisplay))

button._tooltip: c e g b♭ d♭'
c e g b♭ d♯'
c e g b♭ d' f'
button.script: (DenemoInsertChordTransposed "c' e' g' bes' d'' f''" 'c') (d-DirectivePut-chord-display "ChordName" (DenemoGetNoteAndAccidental)) (d-DirectivePut-chord-gx "ChordName" -10) (d-DirectivePut-chord-graphic "ChordName" " 11 Denemo 16") (d-MoveCursorRight)

button._tooltip: c e g b♭ d' f♯'
button.script: (DenemoInsertChordTransposed "c' e' g' bes' d'' fis''" 'c') (d-DirectivePut-chord-display "ChordName" (DenemoGetNoteAndAccidental)) (d-DirectivePut-chord-gx "ChordName" -15) (d-DirectivePut-chord-graphic "ChordName" " 7#11 Denemo 16") (d-MoveCursorRight)
